Questionnaire.QuestionnaireDescription: Evaluate your level of present-moment awareness and attentiveness.
Questionnaire.QuestionnaireIntroduction:
The Mindful Attention Awareness Scale (MAAS) is a 30-item self-report questionnaire that assesses an individual’s awareness and attention to present-moment experiences. 

It helps evaluate how often a person is attentive to their thoughts, feelings, and environment, providing insight into mindfulness and everyday awareness.
Questions: I could be experiencing some emotion and not be conscious of it until sometime later.
I break or spill things because of carelessness, not paying attention, or thinking of something else.
I find myself doing things without paying attention.
I find myself preoccupied with the future or the past.
I find myself listening to someone with one ear, doing something else at the same time.
I drive places on ‘automatic pilot’ and then wonder why I went there.
I find myself reading something and re-reading it without knowing it.
I notice the smells and aromas of things.
I find myself lost in thought about the future or past.
I find myself doing things without paying attention.
I find myself concentrating on what I’m doing.
I find myself rushing through activities without being really attentive.
I notice the sensations of my body as I interact with the world.
I tend to walk quickly to get where I’m going without noticing what I experience along the way.
I find myself doing things automatically without being aware of them.
I notice changes in my environment.
I am aware of my feelings and emotions as they arise.
I find myself acting on ‘autopilot’ without being aware of what I’m doing.
I notice the sights and sounds of the environment around me.
I tend to forget whether I’ve done something just a moment ago.
I find myself preoccupied with my thoughts.
I find myself paying attention to the present moment.
I notice and appreciate simple pleasures in life.
I am often aware of my physical sensations.
I find myself being aware of my feelings and emotions.
I do things without being fully aware of what I’m doing.
I find myself focusing on the present moment.
I tend to pay attention to the little things around me.
I find myself caught up in thought about the past or future.
I notice details of the environment as I move through it.
I am aware of the sensations of my body.
